page.title: 02Living in Collingham
page.content: Four children aged eleven wrote about life in Collingham as they saw it.{ {Andrew Owens}after having lived in Hong Kong for two years was amazed to see that green fields had turned into new housing estates.It is good that Collingham is in the country and not near any factories.There is always something to do like climbing trees,jumping dykes,building rope swings and enjoying the countryside.{ {David Hanson}likes to play football and go train spotting at Collingham's railway station.{Sarah Clipsham}likes the sport and leisure which Collingham provides.Her favourite game is tennis.{Matthew Bancroft}says that Collingham is not too noisy.He also likes the sport but it would be a fine improvement if a sports centre was built.The children all go to the primary school in the village.
